summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Lost in Space
Review Date: 2010/04/15
Store: Stephen Hopkins  (Director),     William Hurt  (Actor),     Mimi Rogers  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Monsters & Mutants
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Lost in Space (DVD)', 'A family of space colonists, their pilot and a diabolical stowaway scientist become hopelessly lost beyond the galaxy when their mission is sabotaged. Marooned in an unknown and hostile region of the cosmos, they must band together to survive in this state-of-the art update of the classic television series.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "Packed with more than 750 dazzling visual effects, this $70 million adventure does more (and less) than give the 1965-68 TV series a state-of-the-art face-lift. Aimed at an audience that wasn't born when the series originally aired, the sci-fi extravaganza doesn't even require familiarity, despite cameo appearances by several of the TV show's original cast members. Instead it's a high-tech hybrid of the original premise with enough sensory overload to qualify as a spectacular big-screen video game, supported by a time-travel premise that's adequately clever but hardly original. It's certainly never boring, and visually it's an occasionally awesome demonstration of special effects technology. But in its attempt to be all things to all demographics, the movie's more of a marketing ploy than a satisfying adventure, thankfully dispensing with the TV show's cheesy camp but otherwise squandering a promising cast in favor of eye-candy and ephemeral storytelling. In keeping with the movie's high-tech appeal, the DVD is a feature-packed marvel, including two audio commentaries, deleted scenes, two featurettes covering special effects and the original TV series (featuring complete biographies and episode guides), the original screenplay, and interactive games.", '--Jeff Shannon']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, Action & Adventure, Mystery & Suspense', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Michael DeLuca, William Hurt, Mace Neufeld, Jack Johnson, Matt LeBlanc, Mimi Rogers, Stephen Hopkins, Gary Oldman, Jared Harris, Irwin Allen, Dick Tufeld, Richard Saperstein, Heather Graham, Robert Rehme, Akiva Goldsman, Lacey ChabertMichael DeLuca, William Hurt, Mace Neufeld, Jack Johnson, Matt LeBlanc, Mimi Rogers, Stephen Hopkins, Gary Oldman, Jared Harris, Irwin Allen, Dick Tufeld, Richard Saperstein, Heather Graham, Robert Rehme, Akiva Goldsman, Lacey Chabert  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 10 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR794043466724#VG', 'Director': 'Stephen Hopkins', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 10 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 9, 2005', 'Actors': 'William Hurt, Mimi Rogers, Heather Graham, Lacey Chabert, Jack Johnson', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Producers': 'Mace Neufeld, Robert Rehme, Richard Saperstein, Michael DeLuca', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'Akiva Goldsman', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Arrived quickly.  I had a small problem getting it to play in one computer's drive, but it plays fine in a regular DVD player.  Probably the computer had a glitch.  Item was as described and arrived quickly.
Review Title: Excellent movie.
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: TCM Greatest Classic Films Collection: Comedy (Arsenic and Old Lace / A Night at the Opera / The Long Long Trailer / Father of the Bride 1950)
Review Date: 2012/03/11
Store: Cary Grant  (Actor),     Marx Brothers  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Spotlight Deals, Mother's Day Gift Ideas in Movies & TV
Product Description: ['TCM Greatest Classic Films: Comedy (4FE) (DVD)', 'ARSENIC AND OLD LACE Cary Grant and a stellar cast romp through this classic farce based on the Broadway hit and breezily directed by Frank Capra. A frazzled drama critic’s two maiden aunts put a secret ingredient in their elderberry wine – and the resulting circus is howlingly hilarious, with a comically rubber-faced, rubber-legged Grant in the center ring. A NIGHT AT THE OPERA Grand opera equals grand comedy as the Marx Brothers cram a ship’s stateroom and more with wall-to-wall gags, one-liners, musical riffs and two hard-boiled eggs – all while skewering pompous schemes to sabotage an opera production. “Arguably their finest film” (4 Star Rating! - Leonard Maltin’s Movie Guide). THE LONG, LONG TRAILER Anyone know how to park this thing? Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz play newlyweds who hit the honeymoon road with a 40-foot house trailer in tow in this slaphappily-ever-after comedy directed by Vincente Minnelli. FATHER OF THE BRIDE (1950) Spencer Tracy is the father and Elizabeth Taylor the bride in this comic celebration of an American rite (and wrongs) of passage. Here comes the bride, there goes dad’s wallet…and everyone’s heart. What sparkling fun!', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Classics, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, Black & White, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Spencer Tracy, Marx Brothers, Cary Grant, Desi Arnaz, Elizabeth Taylor, Lucille Ball', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 1.0), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Runtime': '6 hours and 46 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '400649', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, Black & White, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '6 hours and 46 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 3, 2009', 'Actors': 'Cary Grant, Marx Brothers, Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Spencer Tracy', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '4'}
Review Text: Arsenic & Old Lace is a must for any collection and the other three are definitely worth watching, too.  I admit I wouldn't have spent money on the Marx Brothers or Lucille Ball alone, but now that I have them, I'll watch.  Elizabeth Taylor is great in the original Father of the Bride.  Arsenic & Old Lace, though....  you gotta watch it.
Review Title: Great value!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2012/04/26
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Cecil B. DeMille'], 'Producers': ['Cecil B. DeMille'], 'Starring': ['Betty Hutton', 'Cornel Wilde', 'Charlton Heston']}
Review Text: "The Greatest Show on Earth" is the best circus movie out there.  Made with the cooperation of Barnum & Bailey, it has some of the best acts and a good plot.  The train wreck is loosely based on a couple of real life train wrecks involving circus trains.  Charlton Heston is really good as the circus boss.  He stays behind the scenes and makes sure things run smoothly---not easy when you have a bunch of ego-centric performers!
Review Title: Still a good movie!
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Artist [DVD]
Review Date: 2013/01/12
Store: Jean Dujardin  (Actor),     Berenice Bejo  (Actor),     Michel Hazanavicius  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Hollywood 1927. George Valentin (Academy Award Winner Jean Dujardin) is a silent movie superstar. The advent of the talkies will sound the death knell for his career and see him fall into oblivion. For young extra Peppy Miller (Berenice Bejo), it seems the sky's the limit - major movie stardom awaits. THE ARTIST tells the story of their interlinked destinies.", 'Amazon.com', 'The Artist', 'is a love letter and homage to classic black-and-white silent films. The film is enormously likable and is anchored by a charming performance from Jean Dujardin, as silent movie star George Valentin. In late-1920s Hollywood, as Valentin wonders if the arrival of talking pictures will cause him to fade into oblivion, he makes an intense connection with Peppy Miller, a young dancer set for a big break. As one career declines, another flourishes, and by channeling elements of', 'A Star Is Born', 'and', 'Singing in the Rain', ',', 'The Artist', 'tells the engaging story with humor, melodrama, romance, and--most importantly--silence. As wonderful as the performances by Dujardin and Bérénice Bejo (Miller) are, the real star of', 'The Artist', 'is cinematographer Guillaume Schiffman. Visually, the film is stunning. Crisp and beautifully contrasted, each frame is so wonderfully constructed that this sweet and unique little movie is transformed from entertaining fluff to a profound cinematic achievement. --', 'Kira Canny']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'December 31, 2017', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25291000', 'Director': 'Michel Hazanavicius', 'Media Format': 'DVD, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 41 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 26, 2012', 'Actors': 'Jean Dujardin, Berenice Bejo, James Cromwell, Penelope Miller, Malcolm McDowell', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Producers': 'Thomas Langmann', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I bought this specifically because it was a silent movie and would go well on my Nook (its hard to hear).  Fits the bill.  Wish there were more silents for that purpose.

Review Text: I finally got around to watching this because I needed something light to take my mind off other things.  This animated movie has the best animation detail I've yet seen and the plot was solid.  The horse was unrealistic, but very funny with a lot of dog characteristics.  Watched it twice through.

Review Text: Liberties were taken, but the story is still good and gives insight into how Peter Pan came to be.  In real life the children were much younger when J. M. Barry met the family and the woman's husband was very much alive.  He did, however, adopt the children when their parents both died and shared custody with their grandmother.
Review Title: Good insight into the creator of Peter Pan
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/08/20
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ed Bianchi', 'Daniel Minahan', 'Davis Guggenheim', 'Gregg Fienberg', 'Mark Tinker', 'Steve Shill', 'Alan Taylor', 'Michael Engler', 'Walter Hill', 'Michael Almereyda'], 'Producers': ['David Milch', 'Davis Guggenheim', 'Scott Stephens'], 'Starring': ['Timothy Olyphant', 'Ian McShane', 'Molly Parker'], 'Studio': ['HBO']}
Review Text: The bad language is not 19th century bad language, but 20th century and they use the same four words over and over like they didn't know any others.  It's definitely for shock effect and not authenticity.  Since they didn't bother to do their homework and use slang and curses appropriate to the time, I won't bother watching more of the first episode.  Of course, it ain't my funeral if they can't cuss worth a dang.
Review Title: The wrong slang for the time period.
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: Having bought previous seasons on Poldark, I knew I'd get a new episode once a week until the season was complete.  It's my Monday treat.  By getting it as downloads, I don't have to mess with DVD players either.  I can watch it just about anywhere on my Kindle (including the gym and the bathroom).  I've thoroughly enjoyed the Poldark series from the beginning and was only sad to learn that this season would be the last one.
Review Title: Still an excellent series!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

prompt:
Based on the provided purchase history, generate three separate summaries focusing on different aspects of the user's experiences. Each summary should be under 256 words. Focus only on keywords and clear trends supported by multiple interactions. Do not repeat specific product names or details. avoid repeating product names, specifications, or technical details:

        1. POSITIVE: Describe only the positive experiences and what was liked.

        2. NEGATIVE: Describe only the negative experiences and what was disliked.

        3. OVERALL: Provide a overall summary including both positive and negative aspects.

        Here's the purchase data:

        === Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Lost in Space
Review Date: 2010/04/15
Store: Stephen Hopkins  (Director),     William Hurt  (Actor),     Mimi Rogers  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Monsters & Mutants
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Lost in Space (DVD)', 'A family of space colonists, their pilot and a diabolical stowaway scientist become hopelessly lost beyond the galaxy when their mission is sabotaged. Marooned in an unknown and hostile region of the cosmos, they must band together to survive in this state-of-the art update of the classic television series.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "Packed with more than 750 dazzling visual effects, this $70 million adventure does more (and less) than give the 1965-68 TV series a state-of-the-art face-lift. Aimed at an audience that wasn't born when the series originally aired, the sci-fi extravaganza doesn't even require familiarity, despite cameo appearances by several of the TV show's original cast members. Instead it's a high-tech hybrid of the original premise with enough sensory overload to qualify as a spectacular big-screen video game, supported by a time-travel premise that's adequately clever but hardly original. It's certainly never boring, and visually it's an occasionally awesome demonstration of special effects technology. But in its attempt to be all things to all demographics, the movie's more of a marketing ploy than a satisfying adventure, thankfully dispensing with the TV show's cheesy camp but otherwise squandering a promising cast in favor of eye-candy and ephemeral storytelling. In keeping with the movie's high-tech appeal, the DVD is a feature-packed marvel, including two audio commentaries, deleted scenes, two featurettes covering special effects and the original TV series (featuring complete biographies and episode guides), the original screenplay, and interactive games.", '--Jeff Shannon']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, Action & Adventure, Mystery & Suspense', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Michael DeLuca, William Hurt, Mace Neufeld, Jack Johnson, Matt LeBlanc, Mimi Rogers, Stephen Hopkins, Gary Oldman, Jared Harris, Irwin Allen, Dick Tufeld, Richard Saperstein, Heather Graham, Robert Rehme, Akiva Goldsman, Lacey ChabertMichael DeLuca, William Hurt, Mace Neufeld, Jack Johnson, Matt LeBlanc, Mimi Rogers, Stephen Hopkins, Gary Oldman, Jared Harris, Irwin Allen, Dick Tufeld, Richard Saperstein, Heather Graham, Robert Rehme, Akiva Goldsman, Lacey Chabert  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 10 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR794043466724#VG', 'Director': 'Stephen Hopkins', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 10 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 9, 2005', 'Actors': 'William Hurt, Mimi Rogers, Heather Graham, Lacey Chabert, Jack Johnson', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Producers': 'Mace Neufeld, Robert Rehme, Richard Saperstein, Michael DeLuca', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'Akiva Goldsman', 'Number of discs': '1'}

Review Title: Excellent movie.

=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: TCM Greatest Classic Films Collection: Comedy (Arsenic and Old Lace / A Night at the Opera / The Long Long Trailer / Father of the Bride 1950)
Review Date: 2012/03/11
Store: Cary Grant  (Actor),     Marx Brothers  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Spotlight Deals, Mother's Day Gift Ideas in Movies & TV
Product Description: ['TCM Greatest Classic Films: Comedy (4FE) (DVD)', 'ARSENIC AND OLD LACE Cary Grant and a stellar cast romp through this classic farce based on the Broadway hit and breezily directed by Frank Capra. A frazzled drama critic’s two maiden aunts put a secret ingredient in their elderberry wine – and the resulting circus is howlingly hilarious, with a comically rubber-faced, rubber-legged Grant in the center ring. A NIGHT AT THE OPERA Grand opera equals grand comedy as the Marx Brothers cram a ship’s stateroom and more with wall-to-wall gags, one-liners, musical riffs and two hard-boiled eggs – all while skewering pompous schemes to sabotage an opera production. “Arguably their finest film” (4 Star Rating! - Leonard Maltin’s Movie Guide). THE LONG, LONG TRAILER Anyone know how to park this thing? Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz play newlyweds who hit the honeymoon road with a 40-foot house trailer in tow in this slaphappily-ever-after comedy directed by Vincente Minnelli. FATHER OF THE BRIDE (1950) Spencer Tracy is the father and Elizabeth Taylor the bride in this comic celebration of an American rite (and wrongs) of passage. Here comes the bride, there goes dad’s wallet…and everyone’s heart. What sparkling fun!', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Classics, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, Black & White, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Spencer Tracy, Marx Brothers, Cary Grant, Desi Arnaz, Elizabeth Taylor, Lucille Ball', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 1.0), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Runtime': '6 hours and 46 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '400649', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, Black & White, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '6 hours and 46 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 3, 2009', 'Actors': 'Cary Grant, Marx Brothers, Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Spencer Tracy', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '4'}

Review Text: "The Greatest Show on Earth" is the best circus movie out there.  Made with the cooperation of Barnum & Bailey, it has some of the best acts and a good plot.  The train wreck is loosely based on a couple of real life train wrecks involving circus trains.  Charlton Heston is really good as the circus boss.  He stays behind the scenes and makes sure things run smoothly---not easy when you have a bunch of ego-centric performers!
Review Title: Still a good movie!

Product Title: The Artist [DVD]
Review Date: 2013/01/12
Store: Jean Dujardin  (Actor),     Berenice Bejo  (Actor),     Michel Hazanavicius  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Hollywood 1927. George Valentin (Academy Award Winner Jean Dujardin) is a silent movie superstar. The advent of the talkies will sound the death knell for his career and see him fall into oblivion. For young extra Peppy Miller (Berenice Bejo), it seems the sky's the limit - major movie stardom awaits. THE ARTIST tells the story of their interlinked destinies.", 'Amazon.com', 'The Artist', 'is a love letter and homage to classic black-and-white silent films. The film is enormously likable and is anchored by a charming performance from Jean Dujardin, as silent movie star George Valentin. In late-1920s Hollywood, as Valentin wonders if the arrival of talking pictures will cause him to fade into oblivion, he makes an intense connection with Peppy Miller, a young dancer set for a big break. As one career declines, another flourishes, and by channeling elements of', 'A Star Is Born', 'and', 'Singing in the Rain', ',', 'The Artist', 'tells the engaging story with humor, melodrama, romance, and--most importantly--silence. As wonderful as the performances by Dujardin and Bérénice Bejo (Miller) are, the real star of', 'The Artist', 'is cinematographer Guillaume Schiffman. Visually, the film is stunning. Crisp and beautifully contrasted, each frame is so wonderfully constructed that this sweet and unique little movie is transformed from entertaining fluff to a profound cinematic achievement. --', 'Kira Canny']

        NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
        [Your negative summary here]

        [Your overall summary here]
raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user has expressed satisfaction with numerous purchases, highlighting a strong appreciation for engaging narratives and visual effects across various genres, especially in classic films and animations. They particularly enjoyed the quality of animation and overall production values found in lighter films, which served as good distractions. The user values quick delivery and the accuracy of item descriptions, with several mentions of effective storytelling and strong performances that resonate, such as in silent films and romantic narratives. Great value for collections, standout performances, and sound quality are recurring positive themes.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
Several critiques were directed at elements such as storytelling quality and authenticity, specifically concerning language appropriateness in period pieces. The user found the reliance on modern slang disappointing in historical contexts, detracting from the viewing experience. There were also complaints about specific technical difficulties with playback in certain devices. Additionally, certain films were categorized as enjoyable but not particularly memorable, indicating a demand for deeper, more substantial narratives rather than superficial entertainment.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user has a well-rounded appreciation for films spanning different eras and genres, evident from their consistent ratings averaging above 4 stars. Positive experiences focus on visual appeal and emotional engagement, particularly in classic comedies and animations. However, there are notable concerns about narrative depth and historical accuracy, especially regarding language used in period pieces. The interplay between high production values and the quest for meaningful storytelling defines their viewing experience. Overall, the user appears to seek both entertainment and substance in their film selections.

target_interaction.title: Does not include a key scene
target_interaction.text: In the first Kingsman movie we were told a bunch of patrons of the Kingsman Tailor Shop were left without heirs by WWI and they decided to leave their fortunes to an independent spy agency called the Kingsman.  This scene was not in this movie and should have been.  Instead they used a scene where the original agents were designated.  They should have had both and George V should have been included in the formation scene so he was aware of it.  This scene was implied when Oxford asked him to be at the tailor's shop but that shouldn't have been George V in the agent meeting.  Actually it would have been out of character for any ruling monarch to go to a tailor.  They should have gone to him.  I really wanted to see that scene but it either wasn't filmed or it was cut.
